TI_TEXT.P: Servicii de învăţământ şi formare profesională

TITLE.P: Modified Dynamic Purchasing System for the Provision of Apprenticeship Training Provision, Call off for Contracts Awarded for period between 27 January 2021 — 17 May 2021

SHORT_DESCR.P: Lincolnshire County Council implemented a Modified Dynamic Purchasing System (MDPS) to support the Council and its maintained schools procure apprenticeship training in accordance with both the Education and Skills Funding Agency Rules and the Public Contract Regulations 2015. This procurement of apprenticeship training falls under Regulation 74 of the Public Contract Regulations — Social and other Services and as such the Light Touch Regime Rules apply. The procurement procedure also follows Regulation 76, whereby the contracting authority can determine the procedures to be applied. This MDPS is fully electronic and the Council shall is utilising Proactis ProContract platform to host the system. MDPS supports the award of contracts by establishing a Catalogue of Apprenticeship Provision(s), or following a further competition.
This is award of contracts for the period of 27 January 2021 — 17 May 2021.

MAIN_SITE.P: For Lincolnshire County Council and its Maintained Schools the main site/place of performance will be the County of Lincolnshire. For other organisations it is the County of operation.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Provision of apprenticeship training within the T Level Category of Education and Childcare.
Award of contracts under this Lot have been for the following apprenticeship framework/standards:
1) Early Years Practitioner, L2;
2) Community Activator Coach, L2;
3) Teaching Assistant, L3;
4) Teacher, L6.

MAIN_FEATURES_AWARD.P: Award of contracts through this MDPS will be via one of 2 methods.
1) Inviting Suppliers to be included in a Catalogue of Apprenticeship Training, followed by a desk-based evaluation to identify most economical advantageous offer;
2) Conduct of a further competition, with the most economically advantageous tender awarded the contract.

ADDRESS_CONTRACTOR.ADDRESS: Endeavour House, Colmet Court, Queensway South, Team Valley Estate, Gateshead, Tyne and Wear

INFO_ADD.P: Award of contracts through this MDPS has been via one of 2 methods.

1) Suppliers on the MDPS are invited to submit Delivery Plans for each apprenticeship framework or standard they are accredited to deliver. The Council shall evaluate to ensure that the submission meets with the minimum quality standard of 70/100. All submissions meeting or exceeding this quality standard shall be added to the Council's Catalogue of Apprenticeship Provision. Council Staff, Maintained Schools and other partners included within the scope of the procurement will then perform desk based evaluations — evaluating Price and Quality to determine which Apprenticeship Training Programme is the most economically advantageous offer.

2) Suppliers are be invited to submit responses to further competitions issued through the MDPS, and the specific contract will be awarded to the supplier offering the most economically advantageous Tender.
Further information on the award process, including award criteria and sub criteria for both processes referred to above is included within the Procurement Documents.

Whilst the MDPS has been set up to facilitate the procurement of apprenticeship training for Lincolnshire County Council and its maintained schools, the MDPS is available to other local council ie County, Metropolitan, City, District, Borough Council or a Unitary Authority, NHS Trust or organisation and fire and rescue public sector organisations within the East Midlands, East of England and Yorkshire.

The MDPS will run for a 5 year period with the option to extend for a further period of 5 years. The total estimated annual contract value is GBP 2 000 000 amounting to GBP 10 000 000 for the initial 5 year period,extending to GBP 20 000 000 if the additional 5 year extension is used. Lincolnshire County Council and it’s maintained schools attracts an annual levy of around GBP 1 000 000/annum. The additional amount accounted for in this procurement is to facilitate contract awards of the other organisations included within the scope of the procurement.
